Pre-Game Insights: Cyprus welcome Kosovo to Larnaca in League C Group 2 of the UEFA Nations League on Monday on the back of an impressive win on matchday one.
Manager Temuri Ketsbaia silenced his critics with a fine win away in Lithuania on Friday evening.
Cyprus have lost only one of their previous five home games in this competition, but that one defeat came against Kosovo in 2022.
Kosovo have already had their promotion hopes dashed by a bruising 3-0 defeat at home to Romania on matchday one.
Kosovo have had great difficulty in recent years at performing when being the favourites to win, especially in Euro 2024 qualifying.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cyprus only took five points from their six UNL games in 2022, avoiding the relegation playoff despite finishing bottom of their group, but they are already 60% of the way to matching that tally after just one game this time around.
Others: Cyprus are likely to remain unchanged after an excellent away win on matchday one, where they were strong in both attack and defence.
Ioannis Pittas scored the only goal in Kaunas on Friday and is set to start as the main focal point here.
Goalkeeper Joel Mall played an important role at keeping Lithuania at bay and will retain his place between the sticks.
Mergim Vojvoda's late red card in Kosovo's defeat on Friday will see the right-back serve a suspension here, with Florent Hadergjonaj set to deputise for the Torino man.
After a poor performance in attack, Foda could turn to Albion Rrahmani to partner Vedat Muriqi in attack, after the 24-year-old made a big-money move to Sparta Prague late in the summer window.
